ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Slashing weapons for bards question...
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh my, I didn t mean to rile anyone up over this.  Just to set the record straight, I said I ve never been offered more than 7pp for a HQ Bear pelt. I didn t
ygData.messageBody:
Oh my, I didn't mean to rile anyone up over this. Just to set the record
straight, I said I've never been offered more than 7pp for a HQ Bear pelt.
I didn't say I'd ever let one go for that. The only one I've given away was
to someone I knew. And when you get right down to it, I probably would have
given it to him for nothing. But we were both playing rogues and both
roleplaying to some extent, so he HAD (emphasis on the word, not shouting)
to give me something in return. He gave me two fine steel piercing
weapons, a dexterity ring, and one other item that escapes my memory (not
anything really valuable). Bad trade on my part? Probably. Am I worried
about it? Nope. Another of my characters has been looting Gnome guard
corpses, so that 35pp I could have gotten for the pelt has made it into my
grubby little hands just the same.

It all works out in the end.

Peace
Evulia, FEMALE bard of 10 verses, Tunare

(emphasis on the word as well as shouting that time <g> I mean really, does
Evulia sound like a masculine name to you?)


> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Friday, March 24, 2000 5:49 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Slashing weapons for bards question...
>
>
> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Fri, 24 Mar 2000, Kevin L. Crawford wrote:
> >
> > Don't belittle him just because he sold his item for a
> price he liked. I
> > fail to understand the mentality that so many players have
> that "You're a
> > fool because you sold that item for XYZ coins!" It's his
> business and he
>
> Whoa. Talk about reading more into a message that the author
> intended. I never said he was a fool. I said the buyer was
> probably laughing all the way to the bank because he knew he'd
> taken advantage of him.
>
> > had his reasons. Picking on him is just going to make him
> feel put upon and
> > put down on. He chose to do it, it's over. He knows he
> could have made
> > more money.
> >
> > Picking on him about it really is out of line. Especially
> when I'm sure
> > each of us, at one time or another, has made a stupid sale
> or trade. I
>
> I'm not picking on him. I'm confirming that the true value of
> these things is in the 25-35pp range. I don't care what he
> chooses to do with that knowledge. I just wanted to be sure
> he knew the true value, because I hate jerks who take
> advantage of newbies ignorant about prices.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
